alert.note: Alert for Darlington; Marlboro; Williamsburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 30 at 6:28PM EDT until further notice by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Darlington, Florence, Georgetown, Horry, Marion, Marlboro and Williamsburg. * WHEN...Until midnight EDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water may flow over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 628 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Florence, Conway, Hartsville, Lake City, Darlington, Kingstree, Red Hill, Socastee, Horry, Andrews, Loris, Timmonsville, Johnsonville, Pamplico, Lamar, Quinby, Hemingway, Hickory Grove, Hannah and Hyman. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
